website_summaries.verdict: Featuring a sturdy and stable V-shape design, users have more flexibility in moving monitors around without needing clamps or holes drilled into a favorite desk.
pros: Comes with all the tools needed to put together
Holds monitors up to 22 pounds and 27 inches each
Because it's free-standing, can be used on any type of desk surface without damage
there’s also the option to attach to desk, if desired
cons: Will need a second set of hands if setting up as free-standing, or will tip over and hinder assembly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great dual monitor mount, very easy to assemble and kept my monitors lined up perfectly. I went with two of these to do a 4x 23in horizontal mount, and couldn't be happier. I used the table top mounts so I didn't have to drill through my desk, and it has a very small footprint, and keeps plenty of space available on your desk. Fantastic product, especially for the price. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: This is actually a pretty solid mount
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a pretty solid mount. The base is heavy and metal, the arms, tubing and monitor mounts are metal and not flimsy. So far its working well, just needs fine tuning to tighten the parts that can freely move around. My only complaint is there doesn't seem to be a way to tighten the rotation at the very last joint that connects the monitor to the stand. You can adjust the friction for X and Y axis rotation but not Z axis rotation, which keeps the monitors level with each other horizontally. This is OK once they are set, but if you bump it at all they can move out of alignment easily.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Not great.  Not terrible though.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best monitor stand I've owned. Needed something cheap for a couple of 24" monitors for my WFH setup and didn't want to spend a ton of money. The assembly is very easy, though that's true of most products like this one. The biggest problem is the design and weight of the base plate, it isn't sturdy enough to avoid tipping over. You have to keep the monitors pretty far back and relatively equally balanced to avoid the entire stand tipping over. It does the job with limitations, but spending a little more on a higher quality stand would likely yield a lot better result.
customer_reviews.author: James Berwick

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, some tweaking needed
customer_reviews.text: The first stand I ordered was crooked, even with the height adjustment screws fully extended the monitors were still 1/2” different in height. Most of the problem seemed to come from the vertical tube sitting crooked on the weighted base when tightened. I requested and received a replacement which seemed to have the same issue. The tube fastens to the base with 3 machine screws, and after experimenting with mounting it in different orientations I was able to get it to lean back rather than sideways and I was able to get the monitors level with each other. I’m happy with the final result but getting there was inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Audioman751

customer_reviews.title: Best to install through the desk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this stand, thinking I could use it for my 24" and 27" monitor. Because my monitors aren't the same size, I realized it would be safest to install using the desk mounted option. This is not a clamp-on stand. I drilled a single 3/8" hole to mount the stand, which uses a 5" long screw to make it secure. The stand is extremely well-made. It's hefty, with a solid, matte-black finish that feels like cast material. The screws were clean, and I didn't have a single cross-thread, which is unusual for an imported metal item. The price point was about $35, and when I made the purchase there was a 10% discount/coupon offer. I highly recommend this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Shaba

customer_reviews.title: Great duo monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is solid - easy to assemble, well packaged. Once assembled, the monitors arms needs to be balanced so the monitors are not to far out in the front (otherwise, the stand can fall over) esp. if you use this as a free standing duo monitor stand. Once balanced appropriately, you cannot knock this thing over even if you tried. So all is all - awesome duo monitor stand - got 2 x24 QHD monitor on it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cheng

customer_reviews.title: good stand
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I have a pair of Dell P2415Q monitors and this stand really helps with the desk footprint. I used to have apple thunderbolt displays and the dell feet are huge by comparison (though the dell picture itself is much nicer). Easy to make the monitors level with each other and it really tidys up your desk. I drilled a 5/8" hole for the stand and a 2" hole to run the wires through (with a grommet...) Sturdy enough for my needs. Wouldn't use them with monster heavy screens or in a vehicle or rolling cart, though. They will wiggle a bit if you shake the desk.
customer_reviews.author: xavi

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Description of this Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it stated is was a "Free Standing" dual monitor setup but couldn't have been more wrong as the instructions require drilling a 10mm hole into your desk to 'install' this "Free Standing" base. Although the unit does look pretty solid from a quality standpoint, it is not designed to be 'Fee Standing' and you're better off getting a clamp mounted unit which I will order after returning this one. I docked two stars (of four) because of the inaccurate description.
customer_reviews.author: TrogHead

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product...but it needs to be bolted down.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product overall. Unlike some other monitor stands, this one holds the monitors in place without them slipping sideways or in other directions. The overall range of motion is very good. One bit of advice though: It's best to bolt it down to a surface (using the hardware provided), otherwise it gets tippy when the monitors are pulled forward.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Albert

customer_reviews.title: Good stand at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Set up wasn't hard but there were a few moments when I realized that I needed more hands. Balance was only an issue during set up - I move my monitors a lot and haven't had any tipping incidents unless I pull both too far forward to redo some wiring. Just... Y'know, use logical physics. The wire management bits are nice, but I ended up abandoning them for some Velcro strips. Overall, the stand is study and flexible with my ever changing needs. I'd buy this again if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Tips over
customer_reviews.text: Installed 2 light 22" monitors on this and it immediately tips over. The "weighted base" is no where near heavy enough to keep the thing standing if you swing the monitors forward even slightly. The only way I could get the thing to stand on it's own is to have the monitors all the way out on the edges with about 12 inches of space between them which is not how I want to use them. If you mount it to your desk it might stand up better but I wasn't going to drill a hole through my desk for that.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, useful, exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: If you're wanting to buy these you know what you're looking at and looking for, it's sturdy, you just have to test the range/horizontal and vertical while holding it to make sure where you're trying to adjust it to isn't too top-heavy before you tighten it down, because if you're a complete idiot (and we all have our moments) it's extreme versatility could have you putting it in a way that makes it wobbly. Daily use for over two years with frequent (a few times a year to a few times a month) setup changes and it's still just as sturdy as it came out of the box. Super impressed with it!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gilman

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: I have at least 13 of these stands. One of them will support three monitors. this stand is extremely versatile and easy to configure in many different settings. Most of our stands are mounted to the desk using a half inch hole in the desk and the screw that comes with the stand. I love this as it gives you a lot of desk space. You can use thebest that they include with the stand and that works perfect as well, I just prefer to have the desk space. Just purchased three more of these for new employees. Great construction and well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Todd White

customer_reviews.title: What a Difference!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Like the price! I like the fact that this is a circular base. I like the low profile of this circular base. Cons: My other Wali vesa mount plates do not fit and won't interchange with this Wali vesa mount assembly. This Wali monitor assembly does not match the quality of my other Wali monitor assembly. I wish this Wali circular base also had the large hole like my other Wali non-circular bases have.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD BURTON

customer_reviews.title: Features and clarification
customer_reviews.text: If your monitors are off by an inch or two you can individually raise one so that the tops of the monitors are even. Some reviewers are claiming that you must screw down the weighted base, this is only partially true. You may need to screw down the weighted base only if you angled the monitors toward the front or is heavily unbalanced, otherwise the weighted base is enough to support the monitors on its own. There were some minor chips and dents when I received the mount, but after assembly none are noticeable. There added cable management brackets are essential, they'll make your desk appear much less cluttered.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to set up, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: imagine a weak 5'2" person with a small wing span trying to mount 2 heavy 27 inch monitors on an ultra swivel-y mount and you had my headache in a box- but it wasnt impossible and it was incredibly worth it. the instructions were clear as day, parts were clearly marked, everything you needed for both curved and flat monitors. 4 easy to follow steps. The hardest part is propping the first monitor safely while you attach the second, but its doable.
customer_reviews.author: H. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand is awesome! Very solidly built and easily installs to the desk with or without the mounting base. I installed it without the mounting base and it bolts right down to a desk with the cable access hole(s) and still route the cables up through the hole. Now I can lift the monitors off the desk and regain some valuable desk space as well as infinitely adjust the monitors height and position.
customer_reviews.author: F. V. Plummer II

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand (especially for the money)
customer_reviews.text: This dual monitor stand works as it should and feels sturdy. It was very easy to put together and the little plastic hooks help keep he wires in check. The hooks seem a little flimsy and not the best for handling the wires, but there is no real issue with them. When I first attached the screens, they were uneven, but I just rotated one screen a little clockwise and now they are even. I actually saw that problem on a different review and thought I was in trouble, but it was an easy fix. I have recommended this stand to family members.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely superb for my/our needs!
customer_reviews.text: The WALI free standing dual LCD monitor desk mount came with easy assembly instructions and excellent packaging. Simply stated, its design is outstanding. The only reason for giving any criticism is that the height adjustment is a bit cumbersome and is not as good as some more expensive monitor mounts that I've used for work. But for the price, this stand just can't be beat IMHO for personal use. As an engineer, I am really impressed with this product, for the durable materials/parts used, for its stability, and for the range of pitch, roll, and yaw adjustment capabilities. Well done! I'd definitely recommend this product for purchase by others.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Deal

customer_reviews.title: monitors uneven
customer_reviews.text: So, unless your monitors are the same on the BACK where this things connects, this won't really work. I have one that the connector on the back is low down and the other one that is in the middle so to one ends up with one being way too low or one ends up being way too high. IF your monitors connect the same on the back it's a nice deal...even held fast with my dell all in one which is NOT light...so it is sturdy. Wasn't too bad to put together either.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly lee Bell

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Desk Mount.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this desk mount and another monitor because of having to work at home like many others recently. As an Accountant working with a lot of documents paperlessly, I find it useful for me to be able to turn one monitor veritically while leaving the main screen horizontol. I can see more of a documents, spreadsheets, etc without having to scroll as much. The mount seems to be of good quality and feels solid and stable. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Base of the mount is not heavy enough to support both 24” 11lb monitors
customer_reviews.text: The mounting was fine but when i put everything together and attached my two 24” monitors which are only 11lbs each and tried sitting it on my table but apparently they were two heavy and it just caused the mount to fall forward which could have easily broke both of my $250 monitors over a cheap $30 mount that cant even support the weight of what it’s intended for. Maybe I’m missing something but i hughly doubt cause i triple checked my shipping box and the actual product. Hopefully some employee will see this and help me. Until then my review will stay the same.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Joel Harlow

customer_reviews.title: Purchased a set for a new job, after having one previously
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor stand. The option to use it without needing to drill holes in the desk is great. I have (2) 24 inch Dell flat panel monitors on this stand, and it has no problem holding them without moving or sagging. I had this stand at a previous job and loved it enough to purchase it when starting in a new office. I've tried to use the riser style stands with drawers, but with multiple monitors on a desk they take up a ton of room. This style stand leaves a lot of room open for work.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with a 27 and 24 inch monitor
customer_reviews.text: I can say I was surprised by how sturdy this stand turned out to be. I have a vertical mounted 24 inch screen and a 27 inch horizontal Mounted screen. I used the freestanding table top mount ( not the through desk or screw mounted mount —all three are includes) I am able to move screens into position and move the vertical mount horizontal when necessary. Great purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JSan

customer_reviews.title: It's a great deal for 31 bucks but does leave a little to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: On the one hand, installation is so easy that was able to do it with a single good eye and while on Vicodin following an eye surgery, so that speaks a lot to the ease of installation. Mine is free standing do I didn't drill any holes or otherwise bolt it into place. On the other, I'm not going to be able to install both monitors level because there is a lot of wiggle room in the mounting bracket. There's at least 1/16th of an inch between the VESA bracket and the mounting arm hardware. You can see it most clearly from the above photo, and I cannot remedy this problem without some shims in the mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: B. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This stand is heavy, super sturdy, and feels very durable. I have it holding up two 24 inch monitors side by side. It's a little stiff but everything is adjustable. Comes with hardware to mount into desk or with a stand, which is the way Im using it. The arms helped with cable management as I was able to wrap cords around them. I have had no issues with this product. It has been great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: The Wali mount is built like a tank and exceeded my expectations! I'm using this with two 27" Asus monitors and it's great. The parts are organized in plastic sections and the directions easy to follow. Care must be exercised when placing the individual monitors on the stand with the base mount plate since the weight of the monitor will tip the stand if the arms are extended. I mounted myself on the floor and then lifted onto my desk but a helping hand can be useful. Overall great product and I recommend this to others lookin to better organize their workspace for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: bruce hessenthaler

customer_reviews.title: No so sturdy if you have 2 monitors
customer_reviews.text: Before I ordered this item I did my homework and tried to buy a good quality product for my two ~$400 two weeks old Lenovo monitors. I ordered this item which was shipped and delivered on time. I assembled them together as I left the room for a few minutes. As soon as I returned to the room the monitors had tipped over and I noticed scratches all over them but was hoping that they are still working but I was wrong. If you are going to order this item you better fix it somehow so it won't break/damage your monitors...
customer_reviews.author: Behnam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.. We highly suggest this one
customer_reviews.text: We did not have a lot room in our streaming radio studio. Two monitors with two good size bases was part of the problem. This product from WALI was just what we needed. Installation was easy. We decided to mount this directly to the table to save even more room!
customer_reviews.author: ReliaStream

customer_reviews.title: Surface Mount Stand for duel 27" or smaller monitors
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for this solution for a while now. My desk situation does not allow me to mount the other type of dual mount arms. This is the perfect solution. I have been using this for several weeks now with (2) ViewSonic VX2778-SMHD 27" monitors. Excellent built quality and easy to adjust and set up. You can have one monitor in landscape and one in portrait if you like. You can also mount it to a grommet hole as well if you don't want to use the stand. Well done project all around. Simple and usable.
customer_reviews.author: Emigh

customer_reviews.title: Bolts in elbows of arms WAY too tight. Base not weighted enough.
customer_reviews.text: The ‘elbows’ of the arms holding the monitors are tightened too much. I work near a ‘shop’ area and the guys put it in a vise to try to loosen for me. The ‘elbows’ wouldn’t budge! So I cannot adjust the monitors, which is not good. Worse, while I can move the arms a little in their ‘locked down’ position, the base isn’t weighted very well, so the whole thing tipped over! One of them would have cracked if we hadn’t caught the whole thing. I bought this item on recommendation from a co-worker. His is great - and his monitors are larger/weigh more than mine! Mine is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Kassie1350

customer_reviews.title: Not great if you have a heavier monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have two different monitors and one is heavier (Dell). I couldn't figure out how to make the two monitors level, the heavier one was always lower. The major issue for me was that the stand didn't feel strong enough to support the two monitors and I had to have them angled a certain way to remain upright. Otherwise, the heavier side would tip over. Not good! So, if you have two light weight monitors which are the same size, this may work out for you.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Price/Value
customer_reviews.text: The fact that I have two standard 24" Monitors and I had to place a weight on the stand so that they don't tip over is truly disappointing. The arms are not even extended out all the way either laterally or forward so as to cause the tilt. Does not matter. It won't hold up on the stand. Now, if I use the permanent mounting (Cut a whole) on my desk, it will easily function. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry  Serrano

customer_reviews.title: This is the stand to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised and packing made it through fed-ex ok. This stand is well built and designed to perform without flexing or fatigue. I used one of the three mounting option that lets you securely fasten the pole over an existing cord port in the surface of my desk. It worked perfect and so secure I could drag the desk around by it. The wiring control clips are great and the clip for the bottom of the post has little holders built in to keep the 3 Allen keys stored nearby yet out of sight, great idea! My 2 new Samsung 27" monitors look great side by side. Just set up last night.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Super easy build; solids support for my two 22” monitors
customer_reviews.text: Super easy build. Remember paint by numbers? Well, this is the equivalent. Parts come with a parts sheet with pictures and in numbered/lettered bags. Nothing simpler. Bravo! I have two monitors. The stock bases were a little short and shaky for my comfort. Always felt like they were just a bit shy of tumbling over. This mount has a weighted bad and the rest adds more weight. Result: super solid foundation for my two 22” monitors. Not sure about bigger, but I would be willing to go much higher, no reservations. Well done Wali!!!
customer_reviews.author: KV Tahoe

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a dual monitor stand that had a low profile base and this fit the bill perfectly. I needed this for work so I could free up space on my desk. It arrived promptly and was easy to assemble. No issues. The arms have a decent range of motion and you can adjust the height easily. I also like how there were cord loops included to help organize those pesky cables a little better. Overall I'm satisfied and have had this for months now. My coworker just recently purchased one for his desk as well because he liked mine so much.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Holds my monitors up
customer_reviews.text: Holds my two monitors 23" and a 19" no tilting and no wobbling. Stays in place when I reposition my monitor. Lots of screws but comes with the tools to tighten them. Comes with a way to anchor the stand though a hole in the desk. I didn't need to do that though. I wish they made an extension instead of selling other models. I needed to add another monitor and ended up just putting up a 2x4 for a mount. (I'm a gamer and developer so I never have enough monitors :) ) But it works as advertised and I have no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect adjustable stand
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stand to keep my monitors up higher. Years ago I bought wall mount arms but I moved and didn't want to go through putting holes in the walls at the new place. Trying to get monitors at equal height with wall mounts was difficult too. This was easy to install however I had some near falls when adjusting the monitors so I put ankle weights on the stand in case I knocked the desk or monitor. This kit does come with the option to drill the stand into the desk but i didn't want to put a hole in the desk either.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tong

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and hearty
customer_reviews.text: Holding 2 different 24" (ViewSonic and Planar). Base is heavy enough to support both without worrying about tipping. Assembly was a breeze. With only one monitor mounted, it was unbalanced, but that's to be expected. When adjusting the main arms up and down the main shaft it is a bit stressful. The arms seem to be tapered as to not slide down immediately when bolt is loosened, but it will with the slightest downward force. For $30 I'm surprised. Sturdy and we'll crafted. I expected to pay at least twice the price for something along these lines. Only concern was one of the wire routing clips broke during install. Kind of disappointing, but wires are still routed out of sight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I have 2, 27 inch 4k LG monitors and its unrealistic to assume that the freestanding mount can hold them both, however they include a long bolt that youre able to drill into your desk for support and that is what I did. At first I used the V shaped base with the bolt support, then I wanted to see if just the pole could hold it with the bolt, to save desk space. And it did! It held 2 27 inch monitors with just a single bolt on my desk
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Not level and not sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this stand. It was fairly easy to assemble and attached the monitor, but the stand is not level and not sturdy. The one I received holds the monitor at an angle (see photo, left side of the screen sits much higher than the right), which makes it very annoying to use. In addition the "up/down" swivel could not be tighten enough to hold the monitor upright, it kept tilting so the monitor eventually ended up face down. Other reviewers noted these same issues. If it hadn't been for those two defects, I think it would have worked great.
customer_reviews.author: MDG

customer_reviews.title: Freestanding weighted stand can't support weight of monitors and falls forward.
customer_reviews.text: When I attached two 27" Acer flatscreen monitors, horizontally, the weighted stand would tip forward. The monitors are too heavy to be supported by the freestanding stand. If I had the ability to attache the stand to my desk it would have worked, except for the fact that the right arm was 3/4 of an inch lower than the left stand (even after exhausing the leveling feature of the mounts).
customer_reviews.author: Lynita Hinsch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Monitor Bracket
customer_reviews.text: I have two 27 in. monitors on this bracket. The bracket is really sturdy, stable & holds both monitors well! I didn't have to bolt the bracket to the desk. Less work is always nice. This bracket comes with a variety of screws and spacers, but they didn't fit my monitors. So I bought what I needed at Lowes for less than $5
customer_reviews.author: Mat Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Awful balance and hardware quality.
customer_reviews.text: This mount was incredibly frustrating to assemble while keeping balance, and the adjustment feature is faulty. One monitor came higher than the other so, as in the instructions, I used the provided tooling to *try* and adjust the fasteners under the nut. However, the tool seems a bit too small, or perhaps the screw is just too weak for the application. The screws stripped effortlessly and it is now impossible to adjust. Will be going with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: EDT94

customer_reviews.title: This thing works awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical that this would work as advertised, but I am pleasantly surprised. I got it completely set up in about 10 minutes, and it works better than advertised. Both monitors sit higher now than with their own bases, and can articulate almost infinitely. The base sticks out a little further than I was hoping, but i have no complaints. I would recommend this product every day!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: The BEST monitor stand!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is freaking INCREDIBLE. Not gonna lie, I was very skeptical that it would hold two 24 inch monitors and not fall over, but it really does work! It freed up so much space on my desk. I also love that I can use it with a clamp if I decide to change it later. Super easy to put together and adjust. The only issue I had was out of the box the monitor arms were a little tight so it was hard to get them to move initially, but once they got going it has been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Anton

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, with slight and easy to do modification
customer_reviews.text: Holds up in our new COVID home office. My only dislike is, using Scepter screens, I had to jig rig the set up a little. The screws are meant for very flat back screen, mine had a small area that it budged out and it wouldn’t let the brace fit. It worked, I mean it is a one brace fits all thing, so expect that. Otherwise, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bryguy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Discrete good looking. Very Stable. It does the Job.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. The mount-base is well designed and has a size that does not consumes much space on the desk, while ensuring proper stability to the two 24" ultra-thin Sceptre monitors that I brought simultaneously from Amazon. It was quick and easy to assemble the very few parts that yet needed some assembling. I have nothing to complain. Only compliments since we started using it one week ago. By the time way, the Vesa adaptors show the same quality and had a perfect fit to the new monitors. I reccomend the product and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: I started a trend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my desk when I moved to a smaller cubical in my office and went from a massive desk, down to a little L shaped desk. I needed every inch of space I could get. This fixed that problem instantly. For the price - you really can't beat it. Then, one by one, people started seeing my desk and my raised monitors and they ALL bought one. 6 people in the office bought one of these because of seeing mine - we should have just bought in bulk LOL
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Young

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor stand worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor stand and reduces the normal foot print on a desk. You will need to drill a hole into your desk if you don’t already have one small enough to handle the mounting bracket. Don’t expect to attach two monitors to this thing without it being bolted down under your desk; otherwise, it will fall over. Word to the wise. I’ve seen reviews from foolish people who don’t think, when putting these together. It does come with cable management which is a plus. Currently I have two 24” 144hz Asus gaming monitors connected to it.
customer_reviews.author: The_Amazon_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Would be great for some but took up to much space for me
customer_reviews.text: Setting up new home office with dual monitors and thought this would be a great addition. Unfortunatly after assembling it my wife and I both agreed it took up more space than just using the factory monitor stands. I really wanted it to work and liked the look but not at the expense of the lost desk space.
customer_reviews.author: James Schatz

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: I have two Acer 27.5" monitors on this. Supports the weight without issue. But if youre looking for to put your monitors in a V formation at a corner of your desk as I did, the stand is pretty much maxed out at about a 135 degree angle with two 27.5" monitors, which works for me. But if you are looking more for a 90 degree angle you'll need smaller monitors or a larger stand.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my two 22'' monitors. Sturdy enough for what I am suing it for. I wish it did have a little more height ~1-2'' would be enough. But overall it works great. The included cable management snaps work good as well. Very impressed with this considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: yooper_tr

customer_reviews.title: The stand works great. I have a 22 inch and 27 inch ...
customer_reviews.text: The stand works great. I have a 22 inch and 27 inch HP widescreen but failed to realize this unit would only accommodate 75mmX 75mm and not the 200mm i needed. Fortunately I purchased a plate that attached to the existing 75x75 to mount the monitor. I'm very satisfied with the unit. the material feels like sturdy aluminum. There are vertical adjustments on each. The unit comes with a tool management system although very simple but a must to secure tools to the stand. I was really surprised how inexpensive the stand was. I've purchased three and four monitor stands for work, from other makers and I really impressed with the price and quality of this unit
customer_reviews.author: biomess

customer_reviews.title: Good stand to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is just what I needed for a dual monitor. It it's sturdy enough to hold older heavier weighted monitors as well. The downside to this stand is that you must drill a hole into your desk in order to make it completely sturdy. This, if you have two different weights, you will have to do a balancing act. Otherwise, this will do the trick for your dual monitor needs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up - really need to use their desktop clamping
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and flexible stand. This comes with a clamp set to lock it down to the desk which is important as my 23 inch monitors had a bit of a balance issue if I moved them out or forward. this is a very easy to set up stand and the monitor attachments are great. I had to pull one star - although it has a screw adjustment that is supposed to help align mismatched monitors I struggled to see any positive results. I have two models of HP 23" monitors and they mount at different heights and there is a 1 1/2" height difference that I will have to live with. Love the stand otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cosmos

customer_reviews.title: I'm using two 27" monitors and it handles them fine, however
customer_reviews.text: It works and for the price, probably can't be beat (I got mine from the warehouse with a damaged box). I'm using two 27" monitors and it handles them fine, however, can be a bit front heavy when they're all the way up on the support post. I lowered them and it's better. The adjustment is bit rough and it's really hard to just adjust them on the go. There's an allen wrench that tightens them/locks them in place. With 27" monitors, I have to tighten them back down or they'll move on their eventually. Overall though, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mcqueen

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to use because the whole weight of the monitors its not distributed correctly, whenever I would try to adjust the height or tilt the screens, I had to be very careful to avoid dropping the whole thing. It works ok, but I would rather look for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, inexpensive dual monitor stand. Really easy to put together. My only minor issue was a few of the bolts were so tight I couldn't move the arms to adjust the monitor placement. It took me all my strength PLUS some WD40 to finally gets some bolts to loosen enough for me to adjust. Still, overall the stand fits my needs and holds my monitors in place. The adjustments up/down and left/right were good my needs. I didn't need a lot of movement once I had the monitors in place.
customer_reviews.author: Renee MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good budget stand
customer_reviews.text: Update: one monitor is almost an inch lower than the other. One of the arms appears to have shifted downwards. Bothers me a lot not to have both monitors at the same level. Works well, the only complaint I have is that the hex heads on the hinges are incredibly tight! I have never stripped a hex head before, but I did on one of these hinges. They need to do something to allow these to be loosened better without almost bending the wrench they provide.
customer_reviews.author: Brennen D.

customer_reviews.title: but it's design holds it back from being a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with 2 23 Asus monitors. It does a decent job holding them in place, but the joints can be a bit flimsy as my screen can sometimes slant downward. My second and largest issue is how weak the base is. I am unable to use a majority of the discussed range of motion as the monitors weight constantly cause the stand to tip. But the large design of the base doesn't allot me to just move the whole thing forward. Overall, the stand does hold my monitors and serves its purpose, but it's design holds it back from being a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kalen Hamada

customer_reviews.title: Not truly freestanding, not level
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to assemble and the material itself seems pretty sturdy. However, you have to position the monitors in a very special way or else it is not “free standing”. Another thing of important note, the mounts for the monitors are not even or level. There is too much play so the monitors are not level with each other.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fine product.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Just what I needed to free up desk space and arrange my screens more ergonomically. Now my neck doesn't hurt at the end of the day, plus I can move the screens instead of craning and squinting. I did swap out the base for the WALI desk clamp mount, though. This was my first WALI purchase. I'm fairly impressed.
customer_reviews.author: jLAN

customer_reviews.title: Bolts over tightened before arrival, allen wrench broken
customer_reviews.text: One of the 3 allen wrenches sent with the stand was a factory reject and unusable. The bolts on the arms were so over-tightened I could not get them loose enough to adjust, even with divine intervention. The stand is now a useless piece of scrap metal sitting in my office, mocking me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. I have two 27" BenQ GL2760H's mounted on ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have two 27" BenQ GL2760H's mounted on it and there is plenty of room to move and position them. It's designed and built very well. It comes with two different mounts. There's the desk stand mount, which I'm using. There is also a clamp-style mount that allows you to mount it using a hole drilled through your desk, which is potentially a lot more stable, but the desk stand is also very stable and works fine for me. I've been wanting to buy a dual-screen mount for a while, but they were always super expensive and a lot of them weren't big enough for 27" screens. This thing is perfect and the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: 007brendan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: My "desk" is a large folding table. I've been using my desk for almost a decade now and I'm not getting a new one until I buy a house, which is a few years away. It's actually pretty nice for a desk, however, I bought one of the clamp style monitor mounts, and that was absolutely not compatible with a plastic table!! So I found this, and it worked perfectly. Drilled through (darn easy, ha) and mounted for stability for my two 27" monitors. Looks great, functions great, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: 🌟 Emma Elizabeth 🌟

customer_reviews.title: Not stable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mount for a few years now and overall it's a disappointing purchase. It's not easy to adjust once you have it set and I don't find it stable on my desk. It almost fell a couple times and I have had a 20lb weight on the base to secure it since the week I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: L.J.M

customer_reviews.title: Not to shabby
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work to use with my dual monitors. I have a 24" and 22" LG on this. Its not difficult to put together and its nice that you can use it as a stand or use it in a grommet. My only gripe is that when used as a stand there is a point where it wants to tip over. I have an L shaped desk at work and have this in the corner. I only have so much room where I can use it. The base isn't as weighted as you are led to believe. I would recommend this but more for a straight aligned setup rather than the angled corner setup I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship or wrong part sent
customer_reviews.text: Poor craftsmanship or wrong part sent. Swivel arm was way too large to attach to the pole. There is one nut to tighten the arm to the pole and it doesn't even get close to closing the gap to tighten the arm to the pole. Disappointing to have your whole desk and monitors torn apart and then be stranded like this! UPDATE ----------------- I contacted support and they informed me a piece was missing from inside the arm. They sent the missing piece right away and I received it the same week and now have the stand up and functioning. So support was very good. I have changed my rating to reflect this.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: Works well without being screwed to the desk. I have a riser which moves up the down throughout the day. No problem. It took us about 10 min to set up, definitely easier with 2 people so the unit doesn’t tip over while you are adding the second monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Anya

customer_reviews.title: Good Desktop Solution
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for what I needed. The adjustable height screws on the monitor make it hard to align as they rock back and forth. Took some time to get it level and stable. You can't pull the monitors forward like you can with an attached model, but overall, a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: Guy C

customer_reviews.title: Incredible at this price point
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is unbeatable. Yes, it is somewhat complicated to adjust and put together, and most adjustments require tools. However, for something in the $30 range, as opposed to the $100+ you could easily spend, it is rock solid, which is what matters more than anything else.
customer_reviews.author: J Rief

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly impressed for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dual monitor workstation at home. Super easy to put together and mount the plates on the monitors. Love all the joints and versatility. I didn't want to mount it to my desk (drill a hole in the desk? Uhh no) so it was a bit tricky to get it to balance when I first put the monitors on. So far, so good though.
customer_reviews.author: kristin

customer_reviews.title: Good unit.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the $. Pros: internal cord minder optional base for desk attachment included flexible heights (see below) and angles for monitors easy assembly Cons I would like more height adjustment for separate monitors which are not equally sized (deducted 1/2 star, but rounded up) To the manufacturer for the arms, a simple "this side up" sticker would be helpful, but you can figure it out pretty quickly I would like the central arm another 1-2 inches taller. To buyers: must use 2 monitors; I found it unsteady with only one monitor. Overall a good very buy, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack w

customer_reviews.title: Holds monitors rock solid
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to hold up two 21" flat screen monitors. They used to be sitting on some hardcover books, and my wife said that it was fine, we didn't need a stand. After I bought this stand anyway, she admitted that she was wrong, we did need the stand. It is soooo much better with the stand. I was pleased with how sturdy and heavy this item was when I took it out of the box. Assembly was easy and intuitive, and it comes with good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Lurinda

customer_reviews.title: It’s sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Living in California I was a bit skeptical about this thing being sturdy enough to seriously hold 2 27” monitors. I am no longer a skeptic. It’s easy to assemble and very sturdy. I will say - make sure that you tighten the bracket that goes on the pole as much as you can. I thought I had, and then when I stood the system up with the monitors attached, it slowly started slipping down.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dee

customer_reviews.title: ... (of different sizes because that's how I roll) just fine. I work from home
customer_reviews.text: Holds two monitors (of different sizes because that's how I roll) just fine. I work from home, on my couch specifically, and I am constantly shifting my position. Therefore, I move the screens a lot, and this thing is AWESOME. Further, when I want to show something to someone, I can easily turn one of the screens to face the person and quickly put it back into position. Before I bought this product, I was constantly trying to adjust my position to accommodate my monitors. Now I can easily move them whenever, wherever to fit how I am sitting. I should've bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: My better half loves it
customer_reviews.text: As my better half has a glass top desk in her home office, this was the choice. At first I was a little worried because it was going to be holding two monitors. It went together easy, monitors mounted without even a hiccup, and after getting all the cords wrapped and such I let it stand all on its own (while close, in case it toppled.). Even with a little toddler bumping into mommies desk, the monitors haven't budged. Very happy with this purchase. Not sure I would use any sort of old monitor, but all of the new ones weigh next to nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Krunch

customer_reviews.title: Defective right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Could not perform the second step of the assembly process. The horizontal bar would only straighten on one side. The central bracket was not the same length on both side causing the one side to bind about 30 degrees short of straight. I tried to remove the bolt to bypass the binding point. However the bolt was over tightened so it couldn’t be removed. Looks like very poor quality control. Do yourself a favor and don’t waste your time on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I am using this monitor mount with thein landscape and thein portrait. This tops the weight limits of the mount but by keeping the monitors farther back rather than extended out, there is no risk of tipping. The mount is easily adjusted and comes with the tools (and a nice on mount tool holder) to lock the position firmly in place. Cable management is a huge purchasing factor for me and this mount does that task supremely well. Wonderful price point, easy installation.
customer_reviews.author: B. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great mount for your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this desk mount on a bit of a whim. The price point was good and when it arrived, I eagerly set it up. Great desk mount for the money, strong, heavy and durable. The included wrench allows for tightening of many different joints which is great for stability. The only con at all, which is also a pro, I'm sure, is the robustly sized bottom foot plate. It sticks a bit out on my small desk, but provides a nice stable base for my two 24" displays. Knowing what I know now, I'd still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Falls over with height adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Both monitors fit on stand easily. Not able to adjust height really without having to drill hole in your furniture to hold base down. When try to adjust height of monitors the stand falls forward. If you have nice furniture, this is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value but best to have monitors with own stands
customer_reviews.text: This product is a good value. Solidly built. There is still play so you have to accept where it decides to settle. I have two 22 inch screens. You can get them side by side but your options of how are limited. They claim to support 27" screens but that must be fully spread out like a wall or portrait. Overall marginally better than my piles of books. I at least can use that space.
customer_reviews.author: myPenName

customer_reviews.title: good, but included hardware lacking
customer_reviews.text: I like this unit so far. I'm using the weighted base option and it was easy enough to put together. I probably would've given this unit 5 stars except for one major failing -- the wrong size screws for the monitor-to-vesa brackets. They are too long and bottom out in my monitors (LG 24M47) without holding the brackets snug. There are included bushings, but they are too long, the screws won't even reach through them. I'm going to need some washers or a smaller bushings to make it right. I'm sure they'll be easy to find at the hardware store, but more correct size screws should've been included.
customer_reviews.author: D. Studly

customer_reviews.title: Easily Tipped
customer_reviews.text: I ended up having to place hand weights on the base of this stand to keep it from falling over. If the monitors are not pushed far enough back a slight bump can cause them to come crashing down. I accidentally bumped the side of one and the whole thing crashed, resulting in me having to get a new monitor. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Functionally useless garbage
customer_reviews.text: To say that I'm wholly underwhelmed by this monitor stand would be a colossal understatement. To my mind, it's functionally useless because it tips over way too easily. I mounted two 25" monitors that are extremely light and thin, but when the arms are articulated forward and towards each other, to bring the monitors closer together, and the mount is high on the post, it tips over.
customer_reviews.author: nhmtnbkr

customer_reviews.title: The only stand I would buy
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 9 of these stands for my office, they are great stands, the price is good and they work perfectly. Very easy to assemble, works great with just the base that it comes with able to make adjustments to the screens with ease. Once mounted to a desk they are invincible. I have 2 24” ViewSonic monitors on each stand. They can hold larger, I tried to hang a larger monitor and it was just too close to my face from where I sat however they do hold larger then 24 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Greetings from Florida

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemle
customer_reviews.text: I received the stand on time, a day before promised. It was pretty straight forward to assemble. The instruction were easy to follow. Have a helper on hand when you mount the screens. Without two monitors in place it is very wobbly. I think the base could use some extra weight in it. I used a dumbbell on it to give it some extra stability.
customer_reviews.author: meband2000

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding makes monitors easy to see.
customer_reviews.text: Well built, sturdy dual monitor stand. Exactly what I've been looking for. Brings monitors up to eye level so I no longer have to hunch over. There isn't much adjustment distance so it works best if both monitors are the same size. I contacted customer support since a wrench was missing. They promptly responded and sent a replacement. Not only is the stand great, the company empathically stands behind their product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...not great
customer_reviews.text: Fair quality for the price but I'm definitely not blown away. As others have mentioned the screws are too long when using the spacers so you'll have to make a trip to the hardware store for a couple of washers. I tried it on both a Dell U2415 and a Dell U2417 so it's not like I tried to hook up a unique monitor. It's time consuming to try to get the monitors to line up. Additionally, I was unable to loosen one of the allen adjustment points. However, when it was all set up and situated, it serves it's purpose perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: T.O. Perspective

customer_reviews.title: The recommendation to better secure the base is to drill through the desk ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is very well built for holding two monitors. The arms are very strong and support the weight of older monitors with out any issue. However as a single stand while holding two 22 inch LCD screens is unstable. The recommendation to better secure the base is to drill through the desk and secure it with a through bolt and mounting bracket. If I would have known this to be the case I would have looked at getting the clamp version of this stand. The adjustment I ended up using were 2 bungee cords on the stand and supporting leg to better secure the base.
customer_reviews.author: Ruff Day

customer_reviews.title: Two Man Job
customer_reviews.text: Two PERSON job. Yeah. And that I learned from going solo. I pulled it off, but do nOT recommend that route. No family or friends, so, I had to. But be cool. Load the first monitor after assembly? It teeters, so manage or juggle... Your call. But screens are not cheap. The stand is amazing. I love it. Strong, looks good, does a terrific job.
customer_reviews.author: modbantam

customer_reviews.title: A little stiff and doesn't support much weight
customer_reviews.text: I have two specter 24 inch monitors on this stand and when I adjust the monitors I have to be very careful or else they will just drop onto my desk (even though the bolt that stops that from happening is tightened as much as possible). If you apply any amount of weight to the arms or monitors on accident they will drop so I suggest that you find how you want your monitors and keep it that way, or if you want to adjust hold the arm connector so it doesn't slide down. Overall a decent monitor stand for the price but there's a lot of better ones out there.
customer_reviews.author: Deion Harris

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these, 1 for home and after a week, 1 for work as I have 2-monitor setups in both places. Neither desk has a method to clamp to or drill through the desk. The base is sturdy enough to handle two 24" monitors which I have in both places. While adjusting though there were times when it started to fall forward due to the weight, and I had to readjust. Setup was a breeze, adjusting is/was very simple. I am quite pleased with the product and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pigskins

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy mount for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mount my two Dell 24" HD monitors on a single mount to save a little desk space. The set up was super easy, no hole drilling necessary (though that is an option if you want to go that route). The mount is well balanced and weighted, I don't feel like there's any significant risk of the monitors tipping. I even accidentally bumped them while cleaning in the area and they did not fall. We'll see how it holds up when I replace with 25"+ 2k monitors soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Esau

customer_reviews.title: Almost outSTANDing
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for 2 identical 25' Acer monitors and have it on top of a glass desk. The stand is solid as a rock as far as construction. Surprisingly heavyweight material for such an inexpensive product. I had no issues putting it together and mounting my monitors to it. There are PLENTY of points of adjustment. and with just a little fiddling I had my monitors exactly the way I want them. One suggestion I could make to the manufacturer would be: if the center post is hollow, make the top cap removable so that people could add weights to the center post.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Really Like Wali Dual Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: This Wali Dual Monitor Stand is fully customizable. I have a desk with a hutch and had been hesitant to use two monitors because of the lack of space. However, with this stand and different bases allows for flexibility and made it possible for my needs. I did have to trim the post for what I needed to do, but not a big issue. It's unlikely anyone else may need to do this, but I'm mentioning it as "thinking outside the box" idea. The articulating arms have a wide range of motion .
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: Great mount for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice little stand for the price. Bought a few of them for the office and had them all up and installed, took just a few minutes each. My one gripe: Somehow none of the monitor mounting screws they provided worked for our monitors! They provide nice shorter thumb screws, as well as longer screws with spacers for different monitor configs. Our monitors somehow were in the slim selection of monitors that needed a screw length somewhere in between!
customer_reviews.author: OptimusPrimeNOW

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, surprised how much desk space this saves
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these now. Once both monitors are attached and configured it is very stable and has great range of motion. This saves a bunch of desk space and allows me to make my monitors at a more comfortable height for myself.
customer_reviews.author: lou lou

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent stand
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand is a good value. It's cable handling features don't really work for my application. They might be fine for others. The stand is pretty stable. I was surprised that it would stand on its own with one monitor connected while I was setting up the other to be installed. I'd give 4.5 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C.
